available.description:
identifies if device is available for use (ie. is not "currently" in
 use)

devlinks.description: list of udev generated symlinks by which device may be identified

filesystem.description: filesystem information in case where a filesystem is present

mountpoint.description: path where filesystem is currently mounted

model.description: device model - useful for identifying mayastor devices

partition.description: partition information in case where device represents a partition

parent.description: devname of parent device to which this partition belongs

size.description: size of device in (512 byte) blocks

children.description:
replica can be iscsi and nvmf remote targets or a local spdk bdev
 (i.e. bdev:///name-of-the-bdev).

 uris to the targets we connect to

size.description: size of the device in bytes

disks.description: disk device paths or URIs to be claimed by the pool

items.description:
Pool device URI
 Can be specified in the form of a file path or a URI
 eg: /dev/sda, aio:///dev/sda, malloc:///disk?size_mb=100

share.description: protocol to expose the replica over

size.description: size of the replica in bytes

policy.description: Volume Healing policy used to determine if and how to replace a replica

self_heal.description:
the server will attempt to heal the volume by itself
 the client should not attempt to do the same if this is enabled

topology.description:
topology to choose a replacement replica for self healing
 (overrides the initial creation topology)

allowed_nodes.description: replicas can only be placed on these nodes

preferred_nodes.description: preferred nodes to place the replicas

items.description:
Excludes resources with the same $label name, eg:
 "Zone" would not allow for resources with the same "Zone" value
 to be used for a certain operation, eg:
 A node with "Zone: A" would not be paired up with a node with "Zone: A",
 but it could be paired up with a node with "Zone: B"
 exclusive label NAME in the form "NAME", and not "NAME: VALUE"

Includes resources with the same $label or $label:$value eg:
 if label is "Zone: A":
 A resource with "Zone: A" would be paired up with a resource with "Zone: A",
 but not with a resource with "Zone: B"
 if label is "Zone":
 A resource with "Zone: A" would be paired up with a resource with "Zone: B",
 but not with a resource with "OtherLabel: B"
 inclusive label key value in the form "NAME: VALUE"

Includes resources with the same $label or $label:$value eg:
 if label is "Zone: A":
 A resource with "Zone: A" would be paired up with a resource with "Zone: A",
 but not with a resource with "Zone: B"
 if label is "Zone":
 A resource with "Zone: A" would be paired up with a resource with "Zone: B",
 but not with a resource with "OtherLabel: B"
 inclusive label key value in the form "NAME: VALUE"

size.description: size of the volume in bytes

topology.description:
Volume topology used to determine how to place/distribute the data
 Should either be labelled or explicit, not both.
 If neither is used then the control plane will select from all available resources.

allowed_nodes.description: replicas can only be placed on these nodes

preferred_nodes.description: preferred nodes to place the replicas

items.description:
Excludes resources with the same $label name, eg:
 "Zone" would not allow for resources with the same "Zone" value
 to be used for a certain operation, eg:
 A node with "Zone: A" would not be paired up with a node with "Zone: A",
 but it could be paired up with a node with "Zone: B"
 exclusive label NAME in the form "NAME", and not "NAME: VALUE"

Includes resources with the same $label or $label:$value eg:
 if label is "Zone: A":
 A resource with "Zone: A" would be paired up with a resource with "Zone: A",
 but not with a resource with "Zone: B"
 if label is "Zone":
 A resource with "Zone: A" would be paired up with a resource with "Zone: B",
 but not with a resource with "OtherLabel: B"
 inclusive label key value in the form "NAME: VALUE"

Includes resources with the same $label or $label:$value eg:
 if label is "Zone: A":
 A resource with "Zone: A" would be paired up with a resource with "Zone: A",
 but not with a resource with "Zone: B"
 if label is "Zone":
 A resource with "Zone: A" would be paired up with a resource with "Zone: B",
 but not with a resource with "OtherLabel: B"
 inclusive label key value in the form "NAME: VALUE"

deviceUri.description:
URI of the device for the volume (missing if not published).
 Missing property and empty string are treated the same.

share.description: protocol used for exposing the nexus

size.description: size of the volume in bytes

capacity.description: size of the pool in bytes

disks.description: absolute disk paths claimed by the pool

items.description:
Pool device URI
 Can be specified in the form of a file path or a URI
 eg: /dev/sda, aio:///dev/sda, malloc:///disk?size_mb=100

share.description: protocol used for exposing the replica

size.description: size of the replica in bytes

uri.description: uri usable by nexus to access it

callback.description: callback used to notify the watcher of a change

resource.description: id of the resource to watch on

Specs.description: Specs detailing the requested configuration of the objects.

node.description: Node where the nexus should live.

operation.description: Record of the operation in progress

owner.description: Volume which owns this nexus, if any

state.description: The state the nexus should eventually reach.

disks.description: absolute disk paths claimed by the pool

items.description:
Pool device URI
 Can be specified in the form of a file path or a URI
 eg: /dev/sda, aio:///dev/sda, malloc:///disk?size_mb=100

operation.description: Record of the operation in progress
Record of the operation in progress

pool.description: The pool that the replica should live on.

share.description: Protocol used for exposing the replica.

size.description: The size that the replica should be.

state.description: The state that the replica should eventually achieve.

num_replicas.description: Number of children the volume should have.

operation.description: Record of the operation in progress

protocol.description: Protocol that the volume should be shared over.

size.description: Size that the volume should be.

state.description: State that the volume should eventually achieve.

target_node.description: The node where front-end IO will be sent to

deviceUri.description:
URI of the device for the volume (missing if not published).
 Missing property and empty string are treated the same.

share.description: protocol used for exposing the nexus

size.description: size of the volume in bytes
size of the volume in bytes

parameters.description: specifies whether to list all devices or only usable ones
parameters.name: all
